column4: Greetings all, I had a kernel upgrade today and lost audio. How do I get audio back?
The machine recognizes my soundcards, I just cannot get it to playback audio
soundcards plural?
do you have pavucontrol installed? itll let you pick which soundcard apps try to play out of
I do have it, but nothing pops up when I click it
try running pavucontrol in the terminal. a window should open
Shows no cards available for configuration--it was 100% beofre the kernel upgarde...
there are no devices in the output or playback tab?
Precisely
I have two soundcards, nvidia and another one...
Any idea how I can get it to recognize the devices?
but it worked on an old kernel? try rebooting into the old kernel then
How?
during boot hold shift and use the arrow keys
And the kernel options will pop up?
Because now I just boot straight into the GUI
shift will give you the list of kernels. use the down key to go the 3rd one (first is your current kernel, 2nd is current kernel's recovery mode, 3rd is previous kernel, etc.)
What do you suppose the issue is?
Kernel is not up to snuff yet?
could be a broken kernel update
Would not be the first time. Thanks!
